title: What if we could look inside human brains? - Moran Cerf

options.text: To control all of our thoughts, dreams, emotions, and memories

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: To facilitate the exchange of oxygen and carbon dioxide

options.label: D

options.label: C

options.label: C
options.text: The music, lighting, and the audience's knowledge of the villain's location

options.label: A

options.label: C
options.text: To be bored by the story

options.label: D

options.label: C
options.text: The audience wants to see the tension broken, either by the scary person jumping out of the shadows or by someone revealing someone's true identity and clearing up the confusion

title: How we see color - Colm Kelleher

multiple-choice.question: When two different frequencies of light waves, such as red and green, overlap, what happens?

options.label: B
options.text: They mix to create a new frequency.

options.label: C
options.text: They co-exist like singers singing in harmony.

options.label: D
options.text: They don't interact with each other at all.

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what is the main idea of physical color?

options.label: A
options.text: Color is a product of human perception.

options.label: B
options.text: Color is a physical property of an object itself.

options.label: C
options.text: Color is a physical property of light itself.

options.label: D
options.text: Color is a combination of both physical and human factors.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main function of rod cells in the retina?

options.label: A
options.text: To detect color in low-light conditions.

options.label: B
options.text: To detect sound in low-light conditions.

options.label: C
options.text: To detect smell in low-light conditions.

options.label: D
options.text: To detect light in low-light conditions.

multiple-choice.question: How many kinds of cone cells are present in the retina?
When yellow light is shining on the eye, what happens?

options.label: A
options.text: Only the yellow cones get activated.

options.label: B
options.text: Only the red cones get activated.

options.label: C
options.text: Only the green cones get activated.

options.label: D
options.text: Both the red and green cones get activated, and each sends a signal to the brain.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main idea of additive color perception in humans?

options.label: A
options.text: Color is a product of human perception.

options.label: B
options.text: Color is created by subtracting different frequencies of light.

options.label: C
options.text: Color is created by adding together different frequencies of the three primary colors: red, green, and blue.

options.label: D
options.text: Color is a physical property of light itself.

multiple-choice.question: How many colors can be detected by the human eye in theory?
What is the main reason why we can't detect colors in low-light conditions?

options.label: A
options.text: Because the cone cells are not present in the retina.

options.label: B
options.text: Because the rod cells take over in low-light conditions.

options.label: C
options.text: Because the cone cells take over in low-light conditions.

options.label: D
options.text: Because the rod cells are not sensitive to color.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main idea of TV manufacturing?

options.label: C
options.text: To use the primary colors: red, green, and blue to create a wide range of colors.

options.label: D
options.text: To use a wide range of colors to create a wide range of colors.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main property of human vision that is useful in the real world?

options.label: A
options.text: The ability to detect infinitely many colors.

options.label: B
options.text: The ability to detect only one color.

options.label: C
options.text: The ability to mix the primary colors to create a wide range of colors.

options.label: D
options.text: The ability to detect a wide range of colors.

title: You are your microbes - Jessica Green and Karen Guillemin

multiple-choice.question: What is unique about the microbial communities that inhabit each person's body?

options.label: B
options.text: They are only found in certain parts of the body

options.label: C
options.text: No two bodies are the same

options.label: D
options.text: They are only found in people with certain genetic conditions

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary job of cellulolytic bacteria in the gut?

options.label: D
options.text: To produce energy for the body

options.label: A
options.text: They are absorbed by the body

options.label: B
options.text: They are converted into energy by the body

options.label: C
options.text: They are snatched up by respirators

options.label: D
options.text: They are converted into chemicals by fermentors

options.label: C
options.text: Our genetic makeup and the microbes we encounter throughout our lives

options.label: D
options.text: Only the microbes we encounter throughout our lives

multiple-choice.question: What happens to gut microbial communities with only a few different types of workers?

options.label: A
options.text: Eating a varied diet of simple, plant-based foods

options.label: B
options.text: Eating a varied diet of complex, plant-based foods

multiple-choice.question: What is unique about every tooth in our mouth?

options.label: B
options.text: They are only found in certain people

options.label: C
options.text: They are their own distinctive neighborhood

multiple-choice.question: What is produced by fermentors in the gut?

options.label: B
options.text: Chemicals like alcohol and hydrogen gas

multiple-choice.question: What do we need to do to manage our individual microbial societies?

options.label: A
options.text: We don't need to do anything

options.label: B
options.text: We need to make lifestyle changes

options.label: C
options.text: We need to avoid all plant-based foods

options.label: D
options.text: We need to eat only processed foods

multiple-choice.question: What happens to microbes in the gut when they are no longer needed?
What is the relationship between the microbes in our gut and our overall health?
What can happen to people with diseases like diabetes or chronic gut inflammation?

options.label: A
options.text: They have a balanced gut microbiome

options.label: B
options.text: They have a diverse gut microbiome

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: They have more microbial variety in their guts
